elements.2211.03061_113c10365b2da623800d60f77890d: Target-specific stance detection on social media, which aims at classifying a textual data instance such as a post or a comment into a stance class of a target issue, has become an emerging opinion mining paradigm of importance
elements.2211.03061_607aac9abd1fe6d44bb72964afed6: An example application would be to overcome vaccine hesitancy in combating the coronavirus pandemic
elements.2211.03061_48c29079194ec2bb5538bbb066c50: However, existing stance detection strategies rely merely on the individual instances which cannot always capture the expressed stance of a given target
elements.2211.03061_a610ca73839740b8721c6023df20d: In response, we address a new task called conversational stance detection which is to infer the stance towards a given target (e.g.,
elements.2211.03061_7b6434a99afd7b3f98b36201c1fbd: ) when given a data instance and its corresponding conversation thread
elements.2211.03061_85c08a236037afd76d54b0c147afc: To tackle the task, we first propose a benchmarking
elements.2211.03061_1e6f9bfa3f6c67e81e6a62762d165: etection (CSD) dataset with annotations of stances and the structures of conversation threads among the instances based on six major social media platforms in Hong Kong
elements.2211.03061_f1ebe3f9678c74e7877ee372bb42d: To infer the desired stances from both data instances and conversation threads, we propose a model called Branch-BERT that incorporates contextual information in conversation threads
elements.2211.03061_d02b67323692fac04d314ebb873b2: Extensive experiments on our CSD dataset show that our proposed model outperforms all the baseline models that do not make use of contextual information
elements.2211.03061_f1457683950fcb0d884368c642ffb: Specifically, it improves the F1 score by 10.3
elements.2211.03061_ea5d1ce32bd64b6ebef8eb1740d34: compared with the state-of-the-art method in the SemEval-2016 Task 6 competition
elements.2211.03061_2fa9370812915b41cb4ee4ad28c6f: This shows the potential of incorporating rich contextual information on detecting target-specific stances on social media platforms and implies a more practical way to construct future stance detection tasks.
elements.2211.03061_ba6980b764e5b719d6299c9f53193: is now prevalent for people to express opinions and share their views using social media platforms
elements.2211.03061_9feb69ae5bab3b1c3f3ee8a3c08ce: , which introduces a new and important channel to discover public stances for commercial and/or research purposes
elements.2211.03061_b02912791712f725fd58475bdacd3: For example, the arduous race to increase the vaccine uptake to combat the recent coronavirus pandemic could benefit from detecting the stances towards COVID-19 vaccination in the way where policy makers can formulate suitable policies to overcome vaccine hesitancy
elements.2211.03061_f9d2a5a3d0367adbd89641c227426: Thus, automatic target-specific stance detection on social media becomes an emerging opinion mining paradigm
elements.2211.03061_097178b3980a8d39504fee333b432: on social media platforms classifies a textual data instance, i.e., a post or a comment, into a stance class
elements.2211.03061_fc41667142d9f399e10125cb2d276: based on the stance expressed in the instance towards a given target
elements.2211.03061_0037f174b8c7091de201de8c6d098: Existing methods for target-specific stance detection rely only on an individual's sentences
elements.2211.03061_2d5c4ae6c09590782ab89af359445: However, such context-free stance inference is likely unreliable
elements.2211.03061_17f64fdc01a2c771e9640fb34f28f: illustrates a conversation thread on a Cantonese social platform,
elements.2211.03061_93dd59ff7d0c6eb5be867ac33aed1: In this case, we can hardly infer the stances of Comments 4 and 9 towards COVID-19 vaccination directly, as the target COVID-19 vaccination was not even mentioned in these comments,
elements.2211.03061_88227b6bb93762d66661404597a5d: Thus, contextual information in conversation threads is necessary when detecting target-specific stances in comments (such as Comments 1
elements.2211.03061_6a175f477e2eeea4d3fb9a0cb4685: To further validate the necessity of contextual information in stance detection on social platforms, we randomly collected 100 conversation threads related to COVID-19 vaccination on six different social platforms
elements.2211.03061_0fc0ae3d8053068cb14e474106c05: The 100 threads were initiated by 100 posts, accompanied by 1,174 comments in total
elements.2211.03061_91b1e8368a118649966e305471a9a: We then asked annotators to conduct a two-round annotations
elements.2211.03061_404134efcca71956791cfcf10df58: In each round, all the instances were annotated based on the stances of the instances towards the target COVID-19 vaccination
elements.2211.03061_e9c469d2d19d4f6c12b3953bf0b58: In the first round, only individual instances were provided to the annotators, while in the second round, the individual instances as well as the conversation threads were presented to them.The outcome shows that 48.7
elements.2211.03061_6404bd348b94cd8b37d11a9ab42ac: of instances were mislabeled in the first round but were corrected in the second round, indicating that it is imperative to leverage the contextual information in target-specific stance detection on social media platforms
elements.2211.03061_e27edfbfb1fc803f915d966225be2: In response, we address a new task called
elements.2211.03061_214041c3f0a065c55986368c8b6e0: Given a target entity and a conversation thread on social media platforms, the task is to assign each instance in a conversation thread a stance label, one of
elements.2211.03061_6a55f3fd7539a4d0e19fb06633e95: , which indicates the expressed stance on the given target
elements.2211.03061_36ce60e3ffed6764f7b03ca6aecb9: This task is challenging to tackle due to the following reasons
elements.2211.03061_de1f926b4c09e72be18d85fe7d7c2: First, there is no existing annotated dataset that addresses our proposed conversational stance detection task
elements.2211.03061_3007553f3377acefeb700e2b5d7c2: We need to construct a new dataset with annotations of stance and structures of conversation threads among the instances
elements.2211.03061_fdd7e687066f0f60a8c9d818bf413: Second, the target of interest may be implicit in the posts or comments
elements.2211.03061_f3128b3f565a0dc197659dd297dce: Even if the target is easy to identify, the stance towards the target may be implicit, even when the contextual information is considered
elements.2211.03061_64e66ce36473521cb0f59ae342b1b: Thus, we need to come up with a smart strategy to incorporate the contextual information in conversation threads to infer the stances of the posts or comments on social media platforms
elements.2211.03061_62272c4bab65ca94596c02fcdbfb1: To address the above challenges, we first construct a benchmarking
elements.2211.03061_a5f199cb648bb2c581b4ada9cd5d8: etection (CSD) dataset from major social media platforms in Hong Kong,
elements.2211.03061_5b925dc63a09d05e3680ccc92fa61: which contains 500 Cantonese conversation threads including 500 posts and 5,376 comments, i.e., 5,876 instances
elements.2211.03061_645152bfb63d68bff8be069a58366: In this dataset, the stances of the instances are manually annotated; and the structures of conversation threads among the posts and comments are preserved
elements.2211.03061_1411c64150021bae70ccc8ecf9ecd: is the target of interest for data instances and the annotations were performed by 4 annotators
elements.2211.03061_ab5a33a3a5989f6e36d1aae3798c5: We also employ several techniques to guarantee high-quality annotations and conduct comprehensive evaluations of the baselines for the traditional stance detection task
elements.2211.03061_e4c6a599f7c0ecb991b5e5890f7aa: Furthermore, to extract contextual information in conversation threads on social media platforms for stance inference, we propose a natural language processing model termed Branch-BERT for the target-specific stance detection
elements.2211.03061_a0a7c52dc8310a885d57249d7e8c8: In this model, each sub-branch in the conversation threads is an input of the BERT model
elements.2211.03061_44600551a8e8c96a71a43f165686f: in order to generate a sub-branch-specific contextualized text representation for each instance
elements.2211.03061_db00a313aeaef34e1504b795cdd10: Lastly, we use a fully-connected neural network to predict the stance in each data instance on the given target
elements.2211.03061_fe1fc008330bdec5559036b192b90: Extensive experiments based on our CSD dataset are conducted to evaluate the performance of our proposed model and the baselines
elements.2211.03061_09918c628b1ced1b0615e3f6490fc: Though the CSD dataset is in Cantonese, the proposed conversational stance detection task as well as our proposed model are language-independent
elements.2211.03061_d7b2bcbc7b85d07c9ffaf3c02d288: Our contributions are summarized as follows.
elements.2211.03061_e999bcb5cc77c587d9bf9c7001c0d: to detect stance in instances with conversation threads on social media platforms and a benchmarking dataset (i.e., CSD dataset) for the task
elements.2211.03061_9cc9321ba8251b29cdf58e73dfdf7: To our best knowledge, this is the first dataset for target-specific stance detection which preserves the complete structure of conversation threads on social platforms, leading to a more practical stance detection paradigm on social media platforms.
elements.2211.03061_4708134fa8c799562a343bbcb8908: We propose a BERT based model called Branch-BERT to address the task
elements.2211.03061_ca160e93868a142f4bcd755dbb103: The model provides representations of contextualized text for the comments in the conversations on the social media platforms
elements.2211.03061_be79e8e69f14b79fe36c0e0d15b91: With such representations, the model can infer the stances of the posts and the comments on social media platforms.
elements.2211.03061_e101cae9b0323ddc87eaeeb83025e: Experimental results on our newly constructed CSD dataset show that Branch-BERT outperforms several context-free baselines, including for example the state-of-the-art method
elements.2211.03061_6cf98d76af1ef1e4037b89d26b562: The results validate that the performance of stance detection methods on social media can be significantly enhanced by incorporating rich contextual information in conversation threads.
elements.2211.03061_9ccf15035e24454529b92bf1389d7: To analyze the effectiveness of our proposed model, we evaluate its performance in various cases when the instances have different depths and when the contextual information is partially provided, which may also shed light on how to utilize the contextual information in different cases
elements.2211.03061_bb59486ee0e10dfc3a9f80883a140: In addition, to investigate how the contextual information contributes to the detection outcomes, we conduct a case study that explores what useful contextual information is learned and leveraged in the stance detection task.
elements.2211.03061_604364ad4725931d72c2bea38dcf6: The rest of this paper is organized as follows
elements.2211.03061_24862a51b05698df7395ecc24ed84: reviews related studies of stance detection
elements.2211.03061_dd5354dffa56fb7a352913ffa847a: introduce our constructed CSD dataset and Branch-BERT model for conversational stance detection task
elements.2211.03061_bd103124f56a98b69fddef1b38a93: demonstrates our experimental results and analysis
elements.2211.03061_9be148d4e661e30be9dbeb00b6346: concludes the paper and discusses important future directions.

elements.2211.03061_fc250407b598c10a6e58cb81d5200: To our knowledge, there is no existing dataset for target-specific stance detection that captures
elements.2211.03061_8a61bd8b9bc8cb845b835534c75e5: Thus, to tackle the conversational stance detection task, i.e., to design machine learning based solutions, we construct a new dataset called
elements.2211.03061_d68fb73554a7a153c4430e24009f0: In this dataset, we selected the prevalent
elements.2211.03061_49e71a8d47e42185718f3569adf7c: demonstrates the five-step procedure to construct the dataset.
elements.2211.03061_2752b3e32fc351616e4fe701bcca3: The CSD dataset consists of 500 conversation threads (including 500 posts and 5376 comments) from six major social media platforms in Hong Kong
elements.2211.03061_36e9e15d386051261404f398ceed6: illustrates some statistics of our CSD dataset, including the average Cantonese character count, and the number of instances with different depths
elements.2211.03061_c783ab74c2fc6dac9a635866cda1a: Note that the size of our dataset is larger than prevalent datasets for target-specific stance detection, i.e., the SemEval-2016 Task 6 dataset
elements.2211.03061_7be3a3ac756579ed1a55bbdbbf08b: A conversation thread refers to a conversation on a social platform that is initiated by a post and contains zero, one, or more comments
elements.2211.03061_2acc8b9b45bfae90b0bd4ba2fee52: provides an example of a conversation thread
elements.2211.03061_e5ecf1835b066dbf685334deed8a0: We use the tree structure to model conversation threads, where each instance is represented as a node in a tree with the post as the root node
elements.2211.03061_2b01e346371b1904646bdc8856c3b: , Comment 1 is the parent node of Comment 2 since Comment 2 replies to Comment 1
elements.2211.03061_c9d5deb1e2f216a9344da4c8f66f3: Such inter-instance relationships are recorded in our dataset which can be used to reconstruct the original structure of each conversation thread
elements.2211.03061_a655f1e4b6653a0e763376616db91: The unique path from the root node to each leaf node is called a branch of the tree
elements.2211.03061_64e1ff3f48defb090e7a52cc544b6: The path from the root node to each node within a branch is called a sub-branch
elements.2211.03061_ed6521c25d20b3c462c0b5a629655: The depth of a node is the length of its sub-branch
elements.2211.03061_a57d8ccfa1e34cb62130428b41694: For example, the depths of the Post, Comment 1, and Comment 2 are 1, 2, and 3, respectively.

elements.2211.03061_5164656f5e4743c99b73933bc1fb4: , we first collected posts from six major social media platforms in Hong Kong, HKGolden, Discuss, LIHKG, Baby Kindom, MemeHK, and Uwants.
elements.2211.03061_c2a705308f2a238d868b4ebbe05ff: Using the keywords listed in Table
elements.2211.03061_c462d6d40507e0a9a66fa0f345e08: ) those relevant posts, which were posted between 23 December 2020
elements.2211.03061_dbf46b6a2e8ea158a5907ed58f12a: Afterward, a manual selection was conducted to remove unrelated posts
elements.2211.03061_9e75d9390df5d5fdcfef40a6c8aa2: , we randomly sampled 500 posts from the target-related post set and crawled all comments under these posts as the comment set
elements.2211.03061_65c96dbecd3767284e29a6531f102: Inter-instance relationships in these posts and comments are recorded in
elements.2211.03061_6fc318950eb043d0f9e431019ce9f: to construct a tree-structured conversation thread set
elements.2211.03061_8f9d1dd94704c691a6b944ecad64e: Apart from comments that express opinions towards our target, there are several comments in which the target of opinion is not our stance target in the comment set
elements.2211.03061_1d26aca25477d6df4ea790462a22c: These comments should be classified as
elements.2211.03061_70139bbada1349d1a9c3465338389: Including these instances further complicates our CSD task.
elements.2211.03061_c14b356d2737a9cd7cb56b5a0e5bb: Since messages on social media platforms are frequently written in an informal style, pre-processing of online textual data is needed for stance analysis
elements.2211.03061_a73b7af64da6f117284079cb9f1c2: , we first clean the data by removing redundancies such as the HTML tags, punctuation, white spaces, links, etc
elements.2211.03061_711eecebef0aee7d63433e1c8ca75: Emojis were replaced with the corresponding words as well
elements.2211.03061_5ef3d2298b76592d3ea6cbf50b438: Then, we leveraged the OpenCC library to convert simplified Chinese characters to Hong Kong standard traditional Chinese characters for text standardization.
elements.2211.03061_4653ceff737689e738be2260f89bc: In addition, duplicated instances were discarded, as well as the null ones.
elements.2211.03061_17c037a9a4c21088f49078539aa70: To annotate the dataset, we leveraged the definition and categories of stance in the SemEval-2016 Task 6
elements.2211.03061_c05df9892fe4a66b15795569f0423: Each instance should be assigned a label from the set
elements.2211.03061_f1fd89aebcf4a717a1fd395783a31: Mimicking how people actually use social platforms, the conversation threads were presented to four independent annotators, who are all native Cantonese speakers
elements.2211.03061_0d70b54a4f39a90b5031aed7ecb15: We trained the annotators for a few rounds of pilot annotations before they started to annotate the dataset
elements.2211.03061_6a3b2c14fc668f5e37f041439bdd0: For reliability, each instance was annotated by at least three annotators
elements.2211.03061_0c96d91e18f46e9c34ed551840c15: In the case of disagreement, the final labels of the instances were decided by in-depth group discussion
elements.2211.03061_663272acccfbc9723918006ec9830: demonstrates the distribution of instances with different depths and stance labels
elements.2211.03061_6d8b8e01412f3df6c4a2278ef4fa7: of the instances express an opposing stance towards the target
elements.2211.03061_4a955bbd913c9b544f9bd9d396f2b: of instances are in favor of it
elements.2211.03061_4df494eac9df1a1397c3464c72626: Nearly half of the instances do not have a biased attitude towards the target of interest
elements.2211.03061_392785f8a5143b02f948b9765053e: Moreover, there is an obvious trend that as the depth increases, the proportion of
elements.2211.03061_28e205a71fdef52314efcf52854fe: This means that instances with deeper depths are more unbalanced in their stance labels, and, thus, their stances may be more difficult to detect.

elements.2211.03061_047d274f8353dd951b7c7e947cd28: As discussed, the performance of stance detection can be potentially improved by considering the contextual information in conversation threads
elements.2211.03061_defbf736b86b8760a43fd27432814: Thus, we propose a model termed Branch-BERT for our conversational stance detection task, which can extract contextualized semantics in conversation threads
elements.2211.03061_042ea53679f797bdb0afc81f90c28: , our proposed model contains three modules: (1)
elements.2211.03061_0e0855ba95deb74eff8a8231c9363: as the backbone to generate a contextualized representation of each token in the text of an input sub-branch;
elements.2211.03061_702b6fe1532dc6410ffa44ce3ab20: -grams features from output of Sub-branch Representation Module; (3)
elements.2211.03061_0827990129413b5a6350ffffd8448: that determines the final stance labels
elements.2211.03061_03c4fb029240135d2ae1991c58877: The details of these three modules are presented as follows.
elements.2211.03061_b0ec7df4e3e1901b8223415b86b06: for each token in a text cannot effectively give deep contextualized representations
elements.2211.03061_74cf2ce4b351d9dd409c11596d5c3: Therefore, we use BERT to generate deep contextualized representations for sub-branches in the conversation threads

elements.2211.03061_c08a2c4b87d81d90c2c8053c17849: Our BERT tokenizer when splitting Cantonese text into characters may incur, a loss in semantic information carried by larger text units like words and phrases
elements.2211.03061_df93857c0a6da7a9224654dc18c14: To reduce the information loss, we employ a TextCNN model to be our

elements.2211.03061_6b469df8532bd50d812e12bcbf968: to every possible window of token vectors in
elements.2211.03061_2ea1a6d459e9f5eacd024ae7ea806: We then apply a max-pooling operation
elements.2211.03061_6c5e81c4227bf49bd456fc1e8b3c3: Multiple filters with varying window sizes are employed in this module to obtain multiple features
elements.2211.03061_26521d67320c7700e4b3e498d1f7e: The generated features are denoted by
elements.2211.03061_91c3f9c6b5475f3b7e3dd12fa8311: by the Convolution Feature Extraction Module,
elements.2211.03061_e16a8dc0dca67036c0afede25866a: we first adopt a dropout layer to avoid over-fitting:
elements.2211.03061_f01c9f9e52af8af37720478a4163b: is then passed to a fully connected layer and a softmax layer to compute the probability distribution
elements.2211.03061_165aca6d0dc492c3657c4bbdfbfe3: over the three potential labels of stances:
elements.2211.03061_55f49f70ca5b383d41f5dc97987ee: is the weight matrix in the fully connected layer, and
elements.2211.03061_5d3a750abadbdfba75cfccf2f2ca1: Finally, the class having the maximum value is chosen as the predicted label
elements.2211.03061_7e84c8368a2614fb3e22e7e0acedc: for the input instance (post or comment)
elements.2211.03061_32aa5aefe02a6c9e950515bd0eab2: We conduct extensive experiments on the proposed CSD dataset in this section to validate the effectiveness of contextual information in conversation threads
elements.2211.03061_663e73f4de264efc632fd600c0ade: In this section, we present detailed experimental settings, including carefully chosen baselines and the parameters used (Sec.
elements.2211.03061_071b3580e48806c9f0ce2fc89723a: As stated, existing works on target-specific stance detection leverage only textual contents in each instance without considering contextual information
elements.2211.03061_7840453b33c53a09fcf360a9de79e: Four such baselines are carefully selected for performance comparison
elements.2211.03061_fa5349b4018b19f784c9e41356f82: The details such as their implementations on the CSD dataset are illustrated as follows:
elements.2211.03061_f112abafa9c1cdc9f76817bd119f8: : a SVM classifier uses word-level and character-level
elements.2211.03061_eca3755060b643b9c7e9a8df5007c: The model outperformed all other solutions for the sub-task A in the SemEval-2016 Task 6 competition
elements.2211.03061_c17af0b27777fddf28d6d29eba73d: To implement the method on the CSD dataset, we leveraged the Pycantonese
elements.2211.03061_10bc62be38798b5590d4512805117: respectively on sub-task A and sub-task B in the SemEval-2016 Task 6 competition among all solutions
elements.2211.03061_905cec91472bde47ac084bdab09c6: To adapt the baseline on the CSD dataset, we used the Word2Vec
elements.2211.03061_fa5bf4eb4288bcecfbc30f6ad69a8: The word embedding vectors are pre-trained on unlabelled Chinese Wikipedia corpora.
elements.2211.03061_f2345aea243d42a444e73909b497f: : the model uses an attention mechanism to learn the correlation between the texts and the given target
elements.2211.03061_2f10dd6bfc78f64bafcc761aa34a9: In our re-implementation, the given target is set as
elements.2211.03061_1b9bd197b62a88653fb9dc77d5fbe: The baseline was initialized by the same word vectors as the previous baseline.
elements.2211.03061_0b441bd039d95ebcc729ac75d0593: : A fine-tuned BERT model for stance detection, which yielded the state-of-the-art result on the SemEval-2016 Task 6 sub-task A. Because there is no Cantonese BERT model publicly available, we first build a Cantonese corpus based on the collected Cantonese text from online social platforms, the Hong Kong Cantonese corpus
elements.2211.03061_f4aadac852f5528dfb206618c597f: , and the Hong Kong mid-twentieth century Cantonese corpus
elements.2211.03061_57368166849077579eaf727be8686: , and then use the corpus to pre-train a BERT base model.

elements.2211.03061_b5bed53f8e8c4e4870ea0a696054e: We compare the performance of the baselines and our proposed Branch-BERT model
elements.2211.03061_20091b9cdfe31ce504af7dbaec6be: Specifically, we use the Adam optimizer to train all the models
elements.2211.03061_ebc3a0097128c722b8578126fcc94: An early stopping strategy is adopted in the model training
elements.2211.03061_f6c3531c881ddd8739360bf2ea0c9: The batch size is set as 16
elements.2211.03061_422cbb37d2cf7b4905428da465182: We stop training the models if no improvement is identified after 500 consecutive batches which is enough to reach the convergence
elements.2211.03061_8e13e8bad6e9ba886fef54bcc10ea: Similar to other text classification studies
elements.2211.03061_9ad45441485b0c93ac448cf273f4a: , we evaluate the performance of models in the macro-averaged F1 score
elements.2211.03061_5789d06db6f468fc02792d3a1133b: The ratio of the train set and test set is 8:2
elements.2211.03061_f2f019407ac2f9ae83cacb053812b: All experiments were repeated ten times on Google Colaboratory with a single Tesla P100-PCIE-16GB GPU
elements.2211.03061_6a2dc3d599283186093603e0c6d8b: We took the average of the experimental results for analysis (see Sec.

elements.2211.03061_bc1d3cdd29192b422c00df6142475: , among all the baselines, the fine-tuned BERT model performs the best with an F1 score of 60.8
elements.2211.03061_01177bcb77514d5803d7788dfd440: This result is consistent with the evaluation results on the SemEval-2016 Task 6 that the fine-tuned BERT
elements.2211.03061_7bb92b640dc666ba03c740118ccdd: is the best model for target-specific stance detection
elements.2211.03061_48aa18efd6dd3d957b2a03faa614c: In comparison, our proposed Branch-BERT model can achieve an F1 score of 71.1
elements.2211.03061_4693039299a2800e7128de7fa5b9c: , which outperforms substantially all the baselines
elements.2211.03061_cac037fedbfcc97550c93e3c8d236: Specifically, Branch-BERT outperforms the BERT model by 10.3
elements.2211.03061_b15f56742ead83815a85a148da46e: Our results validate the necessity of contextual information in conversation threads, which is ignored by all the baselines for the task.
elements.2211.03061_9d8c3d5794002dfe52125be1e288b: To further study the specific contributions of the Branch-BERT model to our task, we conducted an ablation study to evaluate other two configurations of our proposed model
elements.2211.03061_7b4edd883b179053a6f483a12fa13: Compared to Branch-BERT, the first configuration discards the Sub-branch Representation (SR) Module in Branch-BERT
elements.2211.03061_b24f76e92e3cff25cd01eb793b85b: This configuration ignores the contextual information in conversation threads when classifying each instance into a stance
elements.2211.03061_ca03798370b42a170d69f1617555a: We refer to the configuration as Branch-BERT (w/o SR)
elements.2211.03061_0ba1dc885f3cd8a30f29dd99263a3: The second configuration differs from Branch-BERT in that it discards the Convolution Feature Extraction (CFE) Module
elements.2211.03061_0441d4f27caee94e4c622c1ba418c: That is, the output of the Branch Representation Module is directly sent to the Classification Module after the global average pooling
elements.2211.03061_157fa323d9e118f73ea360da090ec: We refer to the configuration as Branch-BERT (w/o CFE)
elements.2211.03061_40d359e4dd6f98a3f3423a3de13c9: that both configurations do not perform as well as Branch-BERT
elements.2211.03061_3e623fabaae55824c32b5821b09a5: This ablation study demonstrates that both the SR and CFE modules contribute to the target-specific stance detection
elements.2211.03061_dc5aedf77dd8653a0093084d21107: Comparing these two modules, Branch-BERT outperforms the Branch-BERT (w/o CFE) configuration (resp.
elements.2211.03061_645d336ecbbecf8f71a184243a1c5: The result indicates that the contextualized text representation of sub-branches in conversation threads generated by the SR module is the key to the considerable improvement of our model
elements.2211.03061_caa87d47c2cd2406cca3c2c818ac1: The CFE module also brings benefit to our model
elements.2211.03061_f1ddebe97a10a649d15238ac4e681: This may due to that the CFE module effectively extracts important
elements.2211.03061_3726b64a980fe0775cbbdf7100a67: -gram features to alleviate the loss in semantic information carried by larger text units like words and phrases that was brought by Cantonese BERT tokenizer
elements.2211.03061_52fa4d8274abcc06457dca3e371fe: Impact of Depth of the Instance
elements.2211.03061_fccfcadee5be5e083d5c2ad194b15: , the instances in the CSD dataset can be categorized into five classes, based on their depths, i.e., instances with a depth of 1, 2, 3, 4 or
elements.2211.03061_23b29c459f9be6e3adaa63f97b73e: In this part, we conduct experiments to analyze the impact of the depth on the performance of the baselines and Branch-BERT
elements.2211.03061_7e243243153d5e1e0bcc9d07b61ea: Our results show that Branch-BERT outperforms all the methods that do not consider the contextual information in conversation threads, i.e., the baselines with any depths
elements.2211.03061_2299bab8b1d1c6d3849c2d667bcf2: Specifically, the performance improvement of our model compared with the baselines is more significantly in the cases with a depth of 2 or 3 that those with a depth of 4+.
elements.2211.03061_6fc37d79fd5c28234b80a910ca6e4: , instances with depth of 2 or 3 account for 85.2
elements.2211.03061_f9cf8fb1a139ee9744963e246cad7: of the instances on social media platforms
elements.2211.03061_df0c12ceba56242f242958f930d72: Hence, the performance improvement of Branch-BERT in these two cases compared with context-free models validates the effectiveness of the contextual information in conversation threads in target-specific stance detection
elements.2211.03061_b9ccb6c8e677ed147d4d7f08a1b42: , the performance variation of any method is more significant than that in other cases
elements.2211.03061_223e694b0733313f2524845ecd9ba: This may be because the contextual information that instances with higher depths require may be generated by more than one user on the social media platforms, which further complicates the model learning, in particular, when extracting the semantic information.

elements.2211.03061_cbe8f262507dfda3f640ba5a54835: illustrates a sub-branch, in which Comment 3 expresses its against stance towards the target COVID-19 vaccination
elements.2211.03061_70f88864b90009d798cd3d8287b3e: illustrates the keywords for Comment 3 and their corresponding contributions to the model's performance

elements.2211.03061_4d7b18def881e1a7b62706831301d: , which are strongly relevant to the target
elements.2211.03061_acaafdc356c722b91ef75cb716064: The result further validates that Branch-BERT model learns from the words related to the target and the trigger words of stance.
elements.2211.03061_aa61970391cec9238a1e497a7df98: illustrates an example expressing neither a favorable nor against stance towards the target COVID-19 vaccination and its corresponding sub-branch
elements.2211.03061_e1645e2e23c303bc5dc31818f0c23: Looking into the contents, we can observe that although the target is mentioned in the post, Comment 2 expresses a favorable stance towards
elements.2211.03061_7028ab511f68e4f462e4a9cbf6b14: This accounts for the neither label of Comment 2
elements.2211.03061_84f879e25c658f776aa24f0056b87: illustrates the keywords for Comment 2 in Fig.

elements.2211.03061_3daf7f2533abfe95205d28f862dc3: Instead, the keywords for Comment 2 include

elements.2211.03061_4f11bfea660e3889e8e0520df340f: Given a practical stance detection scenario on social media platforms, we propose the conversational stance detection task which is to detect stances of the posts or comments in conversation threads on these platforms
elements.2211.03061_c7e14a005df1f555a23adb6e27d7f: To address this task, we constructed a Cantonese benchmarking CSD dataset with annotations of stances and conversation threads among the instances
elements.2211.03061_16a16f81d7bee36921e83dacd119b: Furthermore, we propose the Branch-BERT model that incorporates information in conversation threads in target-specific stance detection
elements.2211.03061_351a8972e5514e5808a7c9c0a0b18: Experimental results on CSD dataset confirm the effectiveness of using contextual information in detecting target-specific stances
elements.2211.03061_e431dc9382c5d4f016f07d2b564f5: Our study paves the way for future stance detection on social media platforms and sheds light on how to utilize contextual information in online conversations effectively
elements.2211.03061_5099f17fe9952b585d80b0f0be7ce: For possible future research, one interesting direction is to extend our proposed conversational stance detection task to use additional contextual information, such as comments in other branches in the conversation threads, or the behavioral information of the users who post the posts and comments.
